alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Hancock; Seneca; Wyandot (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 2:21PM EDT until August 12 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Seneca County in northwestern Ohio... Wyandot County in northwestern Ohio... Northwestern Crawford County in north central Ohio... Southeastern Hancock County in northwestern Ohio... * Until 300 PM EDT. * At 220 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Vanlue, or 9 miles southeast of Findlay, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Upper Sandusky, Sycamore, Vanlue, New Riegel, Carey, Benton, Nevada, Mount Blanchard, Wharton, Kirby and Oceola. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for north central and northwestern Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for north central and northwestern Ohio.
